segment.source: Edit a GPO Offline
segment.target: Edit a GPO Offline

segment.source: Edit a GPO Offline
segment.target: Edit a GPO Offline

segment.source: Edit a GPO Offline
segment.target: Edit a GPO Offline

segment.source: To make changes to a controlled Group Policy Object (GPO), you must first check out a copy of the GPO from the archive.
segment.target: To make changes to a controlled Group Policy Object (GPO), you must first check out a copy of the GPO from the archive.

segment.source: No one else will be able to modify the GPO until it is checked in again, preventing the introduction of conflicting changes by multiple Group Policy administrators.
segment.target: No one else will be able to modify the GPO until it is checked in again, preventing the introduction of conflicting changes by multiple Group Policy administrators.

segment.source: When you have finished modifying the GPO, you check it into the archive so that it can be reviewed and deployed to the production environment.
segment.target: When you have finished modifying the GPO, you check it into the archive so that it can be reviewed and deployed to the production environment.

segment.source: A user account with the Editor or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role, the user account of the Approver who created the GPO, or a user account with the necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the Editor or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role, the user account of the Approver who created the GPO, or a user account with the necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: Editing a GPO offline
segment.target: Editing a GPO offline

segment.source: To edit a GPO, you check out the GPO from the archive, edit the GPO offline, and then check the GPO into the archive so that it can be reviewed and deployed (or modified by other Editors).
segment.target: To edit a GPO, you check out the GPO from the archive, edit the GPO offline, and then check the GPO into the archive so that it can be reviewed and deployed (or modified by other Editors).

segment.source: Check out a GPO from the archive for editing
segment.target: Check out a GPO from the archive for editing

segment.source: Edit a GPO offline
segment.target: Edit a GPO offline

segment.source: Check a GPO into the archive
segment.target: Check a GPO into the archive

segment.source: To check out a GPO from the archive for editing
segment.target: To check out a GPO from the archive for editing

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: On the Contents tab, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.
segment.target: On the Contents tab, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.

segment.source: Right-click the GPO to be edited, and then click Check Out.
segment.target: Right-click the GPO to be edited, and then click Check Out.

segment.source: Type a comment to be displayed in the History of the GPO while it is checked out, and then click OK.
segment.target: Type a comment to be displayed in the History of the GPO while it is checked out, and then click OK.

segment.source: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.
segment.target: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.

segment.source: On the Controlled tab, the state of the GPO is now identified as Checked Out.
segment.target: On the Controlled tab, the state of the GPO is now identified as Checked Out.

segment.source: To edit a GPO offline
segment.target: To edit a GPO offline

segment.source: On the Controlled tab, right-click the GPO to be edited, and then click Edit.
segment.target: On the Controlled tab, right-click the GPO to be edited, and then click Edit.

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Editor window, make changes to an offline copy of the GPO.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Editor window, make changes to an offline copy of the GPO.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To disable all Computer Configuration settings or all User Configuration settings, right-click the GPO in the Group Policy Management Editor window and click Properties.
segment.target: To disable all Computer Configuration settings or all User Configuration settings, right-click the GPO in the Group Policy Management Editor window and click Properties.

segment.source: Select Disable Computer Configuration settings or Disable User Configuration settings as appropriate.
segment.target: Select Disable Computer Configuration settings or Disable User Configuration settings as appropriate.

segment.source: When you have finished modifying the GPO, close the Group Policy Management Editor window.
segment.target: When you have finished modifying the GPO, close the Group Policy Management Editor window.

segment.source: To check a GPO into the archive
segment.target: To check a GPO into the archive

segment.source: On the Controlled tab:
segment.target: On the Controlled tab:

segment.source: If you have made no changes to the GPO, right-click the GPO and click Undo Check Out, and then click Yes to confirm.
segment.target: If you have made no changes to the GPO, right-click the GPO and click Undo Check Out, and then click Yes to confirm.

segment.source: If you have made changes to the GPO, right-click the GPO and click Check In.
segment.target: If you have made changes to the GPO, right-click the GPO and click Check In.

segment.source: Type a comment to be displayed in the audit trail of the GPO, and then click OK.
segment.target: Type a comment to be displayed in the audit trail of the GPO, and then click OK.

segment.source: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.
segment.target: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.

segment.source: On the Controlled tab, the state of the GPO is identified as Checked In.
segment.target: On the Controlled tab, the state of the GPO is identified as Checked In.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: To check out and edit a GPO, by default you must be the Approver who created or controlled the GPO, an Editor, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control).
segment.target: To check out and edit a GPO, by default you must be the Approver who created or controlled the GPO, an Editor, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control).

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Edit Settings permissions for the GPO.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and Edit Settings permissions for the GPO.

segment.source: Additionally, to edit the GPO you must be the individual who has checked out the GPO.
segment.target: Additionally, to edit the GPO you must be the individual who has checked out the GPO.

segment.source: To check in a GPO, by default, you must be an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control).
segment.target: To check in a GPO, by default, you must be an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control).

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and either Edit Settings or Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and either Edit Settings or Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.

segment.source: If you are not an Approver or AGPM Administrator (or other Group Policy administrator with Deploy GPO permission), you must be the Editor who has checked out the GPO.
segment.target: If you are not an Approver or AGPM Administrator (or other Group Policy administrator with Deploy GPO permission), you must be the Editor who has checked out the GPO.

segment.source: When editing a GPO, any Group Policy Software Installation upgrade of a package in another GPO should reference the deployed GPO, and not the checked-out copy.
segment.target: When editing a GPO, any Group Policy Software Installation upgrade of a package in another GPO should reference the deployed GPO, and not the checked-out copy.
